annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (g) Irrespective of the kind of corrections proposed by the Commission, the Member State is always given the opportunity to demonstrate that the real loss or risk to the Fund and the extent or gravity of the irregularity was less than that assessed by the Commission services. The procedure and time limits are set out in Article 14(4) and (5) of this Decision.
annotations.translation: (g) 无论委员会提出何种纠正措施，成员国始终有机会证明基金的实际损失或风险以及违规行为的范围或严重程度低于委员会服务部门所评估的程度。本决定第 14(4) 和 (5) 条规定了有关程序和时限。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (h) Unlike corrections made by Member States under Article 19(1) of Decision 2000/596/EC, financial corrections decided by the Commission under Article 19(2) of the same Decision always involve a net reduction to the Community funding committed to the programme concerned.
annotations.translation: (h) 与成员国根据第 2000/596/EC 号决定第 19(1) 条所作的纠正不同，委员会根据该决定第 19(2) 条所作的财务纠正始终涉及对承诺提供给有关方案的共同体资金的净削减。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (i) Where the Member State's audit system - Court of Auditors, internal or external audits — has detected the irregularities and the Member State takes appropriate corrective action under Article 19(1) of Decision 2000/596/EC within a reasonable period of time, no financial corrections can be imposed by the Commission under Article 19(2) of Decision 2000/596/EC and the Member State is free to re-use the funds. In other cases the Commission may make corrections on the basis of the findings of national audit bodies, as where an EU audit body establishes the irregularity. When the Commission bases its position on the facts established and fully documented by other EU audit bodies, it will form its own conclusions regarding their financial consequences, after examining any replies from the Member State.
annotations.translation: (i) 如果该成员国的审计系统––审计法院，内部或外部审计––发现了违规行为，并且该成员国在合理的时间内根据第 2000/596/EC 号决定第 19(1) 条采取适当的纠正措施，则根据第 2000/596/EC 号决定第 19(2) 条，委员会不能进行财务纠正，并且该成员国可以自由地重新使用这些资金。在其他情况下，委员会可以根据国家审计机构的调查结果进行纠正，例如欧盟审计机构确定了违规行为。当委员会根据其他欧盟审计机构确定和完整记录的事实表明其立场时，它将在审查该成员国的答复后，就其财务后果形成自己的结论。

annotations.label: Section-header
annotations.text: 2. CRITERIA AND SCALES FOR FLAT-RATE CORRECTIONS
annotations.translation: 2. 定额纠正的标准和比额表

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: As noted in paragraph 1(c) above, flat-rate corrections may be envisaged when the information resulting from the enquiry does not permit the financial impact of an individual case or several cases of irregularities to be evaluated precisely by statistical means, or by reference to other verifiable data, but does lead to the conclusion that the Member State has failed to carry out adequate verification of the eligibility of claims accepted.
annotations.translation: 如上文第 1(c) 段所述，如果调查得出的信息不允许无法通过统计手段或参考其他可核查的数据精确评估个别案件或若干违规案件的财务影响，但确实可以得出结论，即该成员国未能对受理的索赔资格进行充分核实，则可以考虑进行定额纠正。

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: Flat-rate corrections should be considered when the Commission finds a failure to adequately effect any control which is explicitly required by a regulation, or implicitly required in order to respect an explicit rule (the limiting of aid to a certain type of project, for example), and whose absence could lead to systemic irregularity. They should also be considered where the Commission finds serious deficiencies in management and control systems resulting in large-scale breaches of applicable rules and regulations, or where it detects individual breaches. Flat-rate corrections can also be appropriate when the Member States' own control departments discover such irregularities but the Member State fails to take appropriate corrective action within a reasonable period of time.
annotations.translation: 当委员会发现未能充分实施某个条例明确要求或为遵守某项明确规则（例如限制对某种类型的项目的援助）而隐含的任何控制措施，而缺乏这些控制措施可能会导致系统性违规行为时，应考虑定额纠正。如果委员会发现管理和控制系统存在严重缺陷，导致大规模违反适用的规则和条例，或者委员会发现个别违规行为，也应考虑采取定额纠正。当该成员国自己的控制部门发现此类违规行为，但该成员国未能在合理的时间内采取适当的纠正措施时，定额纠正也是适当的。

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: In determining whether a flat-rate financial correction should result and, if so, at what rate, the general consideration shall be the assessment of the degree of risk of loss to which the Fund was exposed as a consequence of the control deficiency. Thus the correction should be in compliance with the principle of proportionality. The specific elements to be taken into account should include the following:
annotations.translation: 在确定是否应当实行定额财务纠正以及纠正比例时，则一般应考虑评估由于控制不足使基金蒙受损失的风险程度。因此，纠正应符合比例原则。需要考虑的具体因素应包括以下内容：

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: 1. whether the irregularity is related to an individual case, multiple cases or all cases;
annotations.translation: 1. 违规行为是否涉及单个案件、多个案件或所有案件；

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: 2. whether the deficiency relates to the effectiveness of the management and control system generally, or to the effectiveness of a particular element of the system, i.e. the operation of particular functions necessary to ensure the legality, regularity and eligibility of expenditure declared for co-financing from the Fund under the applicable national and Community rules (see section 2.2 below);
annotations.translation: 2. 缺陷是否与管理和控制系统的总体有效性有关，还是与该系统的特定要素的有效性有关，即确保根据适用的国家和共同体规则为共同出资而向基金申报的开支的合法性、合规性和合格性所必需的特定职能的运作情况（见下文第 2.2 节）；

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: 3. the importance of the deficiency within the totality of the administrative, physical and other controls foreseen;
annotations.translation: 3. 在预期的行政、物理和其他控制措施的整体范围内缺陷的重要性；

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: 4. the vulnerability to fraud of the measures, having regard particularly to the economic incentive.
annotations.translation: 4. 这些措施是否容易受到欺诈，特别是考虑到经济激励措施。

annotations.label: Section-header
annotations.text: 2.2. Classification of elements of management and control systems for the purpose of applying flat rates of financial corrections for system deficiencies or individual breaches
annotations.translation: 2.2 对管理和控制系统的要素进行分类，以便对系统缺陷或个别违规行为适用统一的定额财务纠正

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: Management and control systems for the Fund consist of various elements or functions of greater or lesser importance for ensuring the legality, regularity and eligibility of expenditure declared for co-financing. For the purpose of assessing flat rate corrections for deficiencies in such systems or individual cases of irregularity, it is useful to classify the functions of management and control systems into key and ancillary elements.
annotations.translation: 基金的管理和控制系统由重要性程度不同的要素或职能组成，以确保为共同出资而申报的支出的合法性、合规性和合格性。为了评估此类系统的缺陷或个别违规情况的定额修正，有必要将管理和控制系统的功能分为关键要素和辅助要素。

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: Key elements are those designed and essential to ensure the legality and regularity and indeed the substance of projects supported by the Fund, ancillary elements those that contribute to the quality of a management and control system and help ensure that the system keeps performing well in relation to its key functions.
annotations.translation: 关键要素是为确保基金所支持的项目的合法性、合规性乃至实质内容而设计的和必不可少的要素，辅助要素是有助于提高管理和控制系统的质量并有助于确保该系统在履行其关键职能方面保持良好状态的要素。
